jobDescription: OVERVIEW  The Advocacy department is responsible for developing and managing strategic relationships with the patient advocacy and patient community. The insights and learnings shared through the advocacy community help drive internal strategies and decisions to help Genomic Health meet the needs of the patient community.  The Patient Advocacy intern will be directly responsible for supporting both Advocacy and Communications activities to improve the impact of the department’s work through social media, online and advocacy channels to further educate the patient community about genomic testing and its role in cancer care. RESPONSIBILITIESPrepare and coordinate patient advocacy partnerships via online and in-person channels in the breast, colon, and prostate communitiesIdentify educational opportunities within the patient and advocacy community around genomic testing, including its impact on patient outcomes and current standards of careIdentify key channels and strategies to support the broad expansion of Genomic Health’s online patient education programs, including the Coach platforms, MyBreastCancerTreatment, and MyProstateCancerTreatmentWork with internal stakeholders to educate GHI teams about patient and advocate resources relevant to their business objectivesOther duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONSREQUIREDFocus in either Public Relations/Communications or Science-related fieldsProficiency in computer skills and Microsoft Office systemsFamiliarity with social media platforms including Twitter, Facebook, etc.Strong communicator with the ability to maintain open communication with internal employees, managers, and customersAbility to manage multiple, simultaneous tasks and meet deadlinesAble to integrate and apply feedback in a professional mannerAble to prioritize and drive to results with a high emphasis on qualityAbility to work as part of a teamDESIREDPrevious experience in the communications, healthcare, pharmaceutical, or biotech industriesCritical thinking skills
